quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Study and Science
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, field, maluku. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Mostly completed in 2008 and located on the Yangtze River, what construction marvel is billed as the Worlds Largest Electricity-Generating Plant?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three Gorges Dam

questions.question: With a depth of approximately 36,000 feet, Challenger Deep is the lowest point on Earth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the field of study of the science called Anthrozoology?

options.text: Food chains in the animal kingdom

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Human-animal interaction

questions.question: What former capital of Japan lends its name to a famous Protocol aimed at combating global warming?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kyoto

questions.question: On what continent is the Great Sandy Desert located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Australia

questions.question: What is the other name of the Indonesian archipelago known as the Maluku Islands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spice Islands

questions.question: In what Italian city does the famous Uffizi Gallery located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Florence

questions.question: Herpetology is a science that focuses on the study of which of the following organisms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amphibians and reptiles

questions.question: What does conchology study?

options.text: Hairs, nails and quills of mammals

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mollusk shells

questions.question: Which animals are the subject of study of the science called apiology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Honey bees

questions.question: Located on the Mediterranean Sea, what tourist hot spot is often called the Paris of the Middle East?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beirut

questions.question: At only 1,122 nautical miles from the North Pole, what is the northernmost point in the U.S.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Point Barrow

questions.question: Held every year from July 7-14, the very dangerous, yet entertaining, Running of the Bulls event takes place in what Spanish city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pamplona

questions.question: At 18,510 feet in height and located in the Caucasas mountain range, what is the highest peak in all of Europe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Elbrus

questions.question: Located about 3 miles from Sydney, what is the name of the popular beach that hosted the beach volleyball competition at the 2000 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bondi Beach

Examination of the internal sounds of the body

questions.question: What film director made the headlines when he expressed his opinion on the Iraq War and George W. Bush on the stage of the 75th Academy Award ceremony in 2003?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Moore

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: River and Source
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, amazon, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the capital of Norway?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oslo

questions.question: What term refers to the horizontal line, 23.5 degrees S, which passes through South America, Africa, and Australia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tropic of Capricorn

questions.question: The Nile is generally considered the longest river in the world.  The source of this mighty river remained unknown for centuries. Finally Lake Victoria was decided to be its source, although there are other theories. Lake Victoria is located on the territories of these three countries.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Uganda, Kenya and Tanzania

questions.question: This is the longest river in Asia and its Chinese name, Chang Jiang, is literally translated to Long River. The critically endangered Chinese River Dolphin and Chinese paddlefish live only in this river. It takes its source in the Qinghai Province, flows for 6,380km (3964miles) and finally empties into the East China Sea. What is the name of this river?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yangtze

questions.question: Name the line, which is the same distance from the North Pole and South Pole and runs horizontally around the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Equator

questions.question: Huang He is the second-longest river in China. Its source is in the Kunlun Mountains at 4,500m (14,764 feet) above sea level. Due to the silts that the river carries, the color of its waters becomes so unnatural that it gave the name of the river . What is the color of the waters of Huang He?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yellow

questions.question: Victoria Falls is one of the most spectacular waterfalls in the world. The falls are named after Queen Victoria by David Livingstone, the explorer who visited them in 1855. The falls are 128 m (420 ft) high and are situated on this river.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zambezi

questions.question: What is the capital of Germany?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Berlin

questions.question: When the streams Biya and Katun join in Altai Krai, they form this mighty river. It is located in West Siberia, Russia and has many names- the Siberian Tatars call it Omar or Umar, the Samoyedes- Kolta or Kuay and to the Ostiaks it is known as the As, Yag, Kolta and Yema. It joins the Irtysh river, forming the longest river flow in Russia. What is its name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ob

questions.question: The Ganges river is considered to be a holy in India. There is a Hindu legend that the river was created from the sweat of the feet of Vishnu, collected by Brahma. According to Hindu beliefs, if you bathe in the waters of Ganges, it will wash away your sins. However this is not very hygienic, as the river is badly polluted by cremated corpses, carcasses, waste from factories and more.  Where does this river empty?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bay of Bengal

questions.question: The longest river in Europe is Volga. But do you know which is the second longest one? It flows through several major European cities, such as Ulm, Vienna, Bratislava, Budapest and Belgrade. The river empties in the Black Sea on the terrirories of Romania and Ukraine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Danube

questions.question: It is the second-longest river in the United States. The longest one, Missouri, joins it to form the longest river flow in North America. This river flows through ten states- Minnesota, Wisconsin, Iowa, Illinois, Missouri, Kentucky, Arkansas, Tennessee, Mississippi and Louisiana and mouths into the Gulf of Mexico. I am not going to ask you about its name, but about its source. What is the origin of the Mississippi river?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lake Itasca

questions.question: What is the capital and largest city of Hawaii, the 50th US state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Honolulu

questions.question: This is the twelfth-longest river in the world. It runs through China, Myanmar, Thailand, Laos, Cambodia and Vietnam. There are various theories about the source and the exact length of the river because there are several effluents of it that are too difficult to explore. Due to the many rapids and waterfalls, as well as the extreme changes in the flow of the river, sailing is extremely difficult. What is the name of this river?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mekong

questions.question: Although the Amazon river is generally regarded as the second-longest in the world, it is the river with greatest total flow, carrying more than the Mississippi, Nile, and Yangtze rivers combined.  It ends in the Atlantic Ocean, but it is believed to begin its long journey from this mountain peak.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nevado Mismi

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pacific Ocean

questions.question: Which of these US cities is largest (by population)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Houston

questions.question: Which of these countries is smallest (by territory)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Marino

questions.question: Which of these seas is largest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mediterranean

questions.question: Which continents (landmasses, not peripheral islands) are entirely in the Northern Hemisphere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North America, Europe, and Asia

questions.question: Which of these lakes is deepest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tanganyika

questions.question: Which of these rivers is longest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Huang

questions.question: Which of these inhabited places is wettest?

questions.question: Which of these deserts is largest?
